intro: Pilosella trichodonta, commonly known as the woolly leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on its leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella trichodonta typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
